verses.roman:
sva-vikrame pratihate
kuñjarendro 'ty-amarṣitaḥ
codyamāno mahāmātraiḥ
kṛṣṇam abhyadravad ruṣā

synonyms: sva—his; vikrame—prowess; pratihate—being thwarted; kuñjara-indraḥ—the lord of elephants; ati—extreme; amarṣitaḥ—with frustrated anger; codyamānaḥ—urged on; mahāmātraiḥ—by the elephant-keepers; kṛṣṇam—at Kṛṣṇa; abhyadravat—he charged; ruṣā—furiously.
translation: His prowess foiled, the lordly elephant Kuvalayāpīḍa went into a frenzied rage out of frustration. But the elephant-keepers goaded him on, and he furiously charged Kṛṣṇa once again.
